title: Why bold and beautiful turquoise dials are making a comeback in women's watches
text:
A talisman of wisdom, power and protection, turquoise has been a favourite the world over for over 7,000 years. Originally sourced from Iran, today the copper-rich mines of the American south-west produce the most sought-after stones.

Piaget's 1960s timepieces with hardstone dials were quickly adopted by the bold and the beautiful, from Jackie Kennedy to Elizabeth Taylor. The house's current collection offers several takes on turquoise, including a Possession watch, with signature rotating bezel, in a 29mm rose-gold case set with 42 brilliant-cut diamonds.

Drawing on 240 years of jewellery and watchmaking expertise, Chaumet's tiny Hortensia Eden has a turquoise dial framed by a pink-gold case...
